page.title: 03LANDSCAPE cont'
page.content:
inter-drumlin lake of 9.2ha. in size.
Drumlins also have affected the road network. Minor roads through the countryside tend to follow the drumlin contours rather than cross them at more convenient locations. The reasons for the drumlin - related road pattern dates from the period of the horse drawn vechicle when gentle gradients were sought. In 1985 the road-pattern is basically unaltered although mechanically propelled vehicles could easily cope with gradients.
The presence of drumlins imparts interesting vistas of the countryside.
